issues.description: [Cognitive Load] Users will struggle to understand precise technical instructions. Evidence: Weak modifiers reduce precision and clarity (Source: Nielsen Norman Group: Writing for Web Usability)
issues.suggestion: Remove unnecessary adverbs, use precise language. Before: "You can simply install the package..." → After: "Install the package using the following command..."
issues.context: Weak words (simply, really, easily, quickly, just, basically)

issues.description: [Unclear Heading] Readers cannot understand document structure or navigate content. Evidence: Inconsistent heading levels disrupt information architecture (Source: Nielsen Norman Group: Information Architecture)
issues.suggestion:
Create logical, sequential heading hierarchy. Before: "## API Reference
#### Endpoint
##### Method" → After: "# API Reference
## Endpoints
### Method Details"
issues.context: Broken heading hierarchy (##, ####, #####, ######)

issues.description: [Missing Context] Developers cannot quickly locate relevant information. Evidence: Non-descriptive headings reduce information scent (Source: Pirolli & Card: Information Foraging Theory)
issues.suggestion: Use specific, descriptive headings. Before: "## Feature 1" → After: "## Authentication Token Generation"
issues.context: Vague section headings ('Feature 1', 'Issue 1')

issues.description: [Undefined Jargon] Users will be confused about technical concepts. Evidence: Terminological inconsistency creates cognitive friction (Source: Google Developer Documentation Style Guide)
issues.suggestion: Standardize terminology, define on first use. Before: "Use your api-key for authentication" → After: "Use your API Key (a unique authentication credential) for accessing the service"
issues.context: Inconsistent terminology (API Key/api keys/API-key/api key)

issues.description: [Ambiguous Instruction] Developers will struggle to understand precise actions. Evidence: Passive voice reduces clarity and directness (Source: Plain Language Guidelines (plainlanguage.gov))
issues.suggestion: Rewrite in active voice with clear subject. Before: "The package can be installed..." → After: "Install the package using npm..."
issues.context: Passive voice throughout

issues.description: [Missing Context] Users might accidentally delete users without understanding permanent implications. Evidence: Progressive Disclosure principle suggests providing prerequisite warning about consequences (Source: Redish, Task-Oriented Writing)
issues.suggestion: Add explicit warning and confirmation requirements. Before: "This endpoint is used for deleting users from the system. The deletion is permanent and cannot be un..." → After: "WARNING: Deleting a user is a PERMANENT action that cannot be reversed. Ensure you have explicit authorization before proceeding. This endpoint requir..."
issues.context: This endpoint is used for deleting users from the system. The deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.

issues.description: [Missing Context] Developers won't know required permissions to access endpoint. Evidence: Lacks authentication/authorization context for endpoint (Source: Google Dev Docs Style Guide)
issues.context: GET /api/users/{id}

issues.description: [Ambiguous Instruction] Users unsure what additional information exists. Evidence: External link without context reduces information scent (Source: Pirolli & Card, Information Scent)
issues.suggestion: Describe link contents before linking. Before: "[Click here](https://docs.example.com/api/users) for more info." → After: "For advanced pagination and filtering details for the Users endpoint, [see additional documentation](https://docs.example.com/api/users)."
issues.context: [Click here](https://docs.example.com/api/users) for more info.

issues.suggestion: Add context to error section heading. Before: "## Common Errors" → After: "## API Error Responses: Troubleshooting Guide"
issues.context: Common Errors

issues.description: [Missing Troubleshooting] Users cannot resolve common configuration or authentication errors. Evidence: No dedicated troubleshooting section despite complex API setup. Framework: How-To Guides missing error resolution pathway. Affected files: README.md, quickstart.mdx. Priority: High friction point preventing successful initial integration
issues.suggestion:
Create 'troubleshooting.mdx' document. User journey blocked: problem_resolution. Suggested content: ## Common Authentication Errors
- Missing API Key
- Rate Limit Exceeded
- Invalid Credentials

### Debugging Steps
1. Verify credentials
2. Check network connectivity
3. Regenerate API tokens
